title: My Seventh-Grade Life in Tights - Brooks Benjamin
description:
Football hero. Ninja freestyler. It's seventh grade. Anything is possible.

All Dillon wants is to be a real dancer. And if he wins a summer scholarship at Dance-Splosion, heâ€™s on his way. The problem? His dad wants him to play football. And Dillonâ€™s freestyle crew, the Dizzee Freekz, says that dance studios are for sellouts. His friends want Dillon to kill it at the auditionâ€”so he can turn around and tell the studio just how wrong their rules and creativity-strangling ways are.

At first, Dillonâ€™s willing to go along with his crewâ€™s plan, even convincing one of the snobbiest girls at school to work with him on his technique. But as Dillonâ€™s dancing improves, he wonders: what if studios arenâ€™t the enemy? And what if he actually has a shot at winning the scholarship?

Dillonâ€™s life is about to get crazy . . . on and off the dance floor in this kid-friendly humorous debut by Brooks Benjamin.

â€œA rollicking, big-hearted breakdance of a book. Itâ€™s a story about friendship thatâ€™s got all the moves: humor both sly and slapstick, a diverse cast of characters, and a winning narrator whoâ€™s trying to learn how to follow his heart, find the beat, and dance his pants right off.â€ â€”Kate Hattemer, author of *The Vigilante Poets of Selwyn Academy

â€œEqual parts jazz hands and karate chop, with a dash of football and a pirouette of pure heart. Dillon and the Dizzee Freekz are en pointe. This book will rock you! â€œâ€”Kristin Oâ€™Donnell Tubb, author of The 13th Sign*
